page.title: 16DUNHOLME STREET NAMES
page.content: In the 1960's Mr. Terence Leach, a local historian, was asked if he could suggest street names for the modern housing developments beginning to take place in Dunholme. He suggested that they were called after earlier inhabitants of the village and so Merleswyn is named after an Anglo-saxon sherrif who survived the Norman Conquest. Paynell was also an Anglo-saxon landowner. Grantham, Kneeland and Anderson were 17C. landowners. Mainwaring and Hewson were I8c. landowners and Allwood and Swan 19C. landowners. Deane Walk is named after Dr. Deane who lived and held his surgeries until the early 1960's at his house which is now the Four Seasons restaurent.
